triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value exceeds policy limit
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or increasing the deposit to meet the LTV policy requirements.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, the maximum LTV for Tier A is 110%. The calculated LTV for this proposal is 102.5%, which is within the acceptable range for Tier A.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Exceeds Threshold
triageFlags.description: The Debt-to-Income ratio exceeds the maximum allowable threshold for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Reassess the affordability of the loan or consider adjusting the loan terms to reduce the DTI ratio.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum DTI of 45% for Tier A applicants. The calculated DTI for this proposal exceeds this limit, indicating potential affordability concerns.

content.reasoning: The proposal was analyzed against the underwriting policy manual, focusing on credit risk, asset and loan structure, and affordability. The applicant's credit score places them in Tier A, allowing for a maximum LTV of 110% and a DTI of 45%. The calculated LTV of 102.5% is within the acceptable range, but the DTI exceeds the threshold, raising affordability concerns.
